revised_title: Investigating the Neural Mechanisms of Word Generation using PET
tldr: The study used positron emission tomography (PET) to investigate the neural mechanisms of word generation. The researchers found that the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) is responsible for modulating the responsivity of a neural system in the superior temporal gyrus, which is the site of the distributed word store. This suggests that the DLPFC plays a crucial role in the intrinsic generation of words.
